title: rifordmedia.com - kevin riford - FOIA REQUEST - FBI

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records regarding the below published articles which can be found on rifordmedia.com, which journalist Kevin Riford frequently writes articles regarding the FBI. I've also attached archived versions. 

1.) https://rifordmedia.com/the-burns-family-donation-to-niagara-county-family-court-judge-erin-delabio/

2.) https://rifordmedia.com/wivb-ch-4-interview-with-christina-and-kevin-riford-fbi-special-agent-brian-burns/

3.) https://rifordmedia.com/a-request-for-assistance-from-the-erie-county-executive-mark-poloncarz-suspicious-package/

4.) https://rifordmedia.com/what-happened-after-my-family-reported-peter-vito-associates/

5.) https://rifordmedia.com/fbi-special-agent-brian-burns-numerous-allegations-of-corruption/

6.) https://rifordmedia.com/kevin-rifords-just-coincidences-fbi-doj-edition/

7.) https://rifordmedia.com/niagara-county-sheriffs-office-district-attorney-state-violations-withholding-evidence-and-more/

8.) https://rifordmedia.com/why-didnt-the-fbi-create-missing-persons-posters-for-katie-riford-and-her-children/

9.) https://rifordmedia.com/fbi-agent-brian-burns-introduces-the-rifords-to-kelly-marshal-but-who-is-she-murder-victim-danielle-cretacci/

10.) https://rifordmedia.com/is-niagara-county-jason-cafarella-a-federal-asset/

11.) https://rifordmedia.com/niagara-county-judge-erin-delabios-brother-arrested-for-child-porn/

12.) https://rifordmedia.com/reporting-fbi-agent-burns-to-nys-erie-county-town-of-tonawanda-police/

13.) https://rifordmedia.com/attorney-mike-dwan-explains-the-target-on-rifords-back/

14.) https://rifordmedia.com/trump-nominee-peter-vito-states-kevin-riford-is-domestic-terrorist-but-who-is-peter-vito/

15.) https://rifordmedia.com/i-was-scammed-by-niagara-county-bail-bondsman-for-5500/

16.) https://rifordmedia.com/danielle-diarbakerly-indicted-with-federal-charges/

17.) https://rifordmedia.com/the-fbi-has-over-600-pages-regarding-me-kevin-riford/

18.) https://rifordmedia.com/kevins-story-the-professor-the-russian-deportation-and-the-monitoring-claim/

19.) https://rifordmedia.com/niagara-county-sheriffs-evidence-tampering-caught-on-camera/

title: Nonprofit Security Grant Program Email Inquries

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Nonprofit Security Grant Program Email Inquries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails sent to  CDPS_DHSEM_NSGPadmin@state.co.us from August 8, 2025 through September 4, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Records retention schedule
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all materials, indices, directives, manuals, and other guiding documentation regarding the records generated and retained by California Highway Patrol, including but not limited to: 

• Record retention schedules
• Any other data structures used for the management of records: digital, paper, and otherwise

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form. If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address. If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. 

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: FOIA Request – Records Concerning May 2025 Rare Breed Settlement Agreement on Forced Reset Triggers

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Records Concerning May 2025 Rare Breed Settlement Agreement on Forced Reset Triggers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I request copies of all records created, received, or maintained by OLC from May 15, 2025, to the present concerning or referencing the May 2025 settlement agreement between the United States and Rare Breed Triggers regarding forced reset triggers (FRTs).

Specifically, please include:
	1.	Legal Opinions or Memoranda – Any formal or informal memoranda, legal analyses, or opinions prepared by OLC regarding the Rare Breed settlement and its implications for firearms classification or ATF enforcement policy.
	2.	Interagency Communications – Communications between OLC and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF), or any DOJ components, regarding the settlement’s legal effect or potential use in enforcement matters.
	3.	Policy Guidance – Any records where OLC provided advice, clearance, or recommendations concerning whether the settlement agreement may serve as precedent or guidance in enforcement matters involving other entities.

Format

Please provide records in electronic PDF format by email or secure download link.

Segregable Portions

If records contain exempt material, please release all reasonably segregable non-exempt portions.

Fees

I agree to pay fees up to $100. If costs will exceed this, please contact me before processing.

Expedited Processing

Requested under 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(e)(1)(iv), because this concerns government activity of significant public interest — DOJ’s role in establishing precedent through private settlement agreements.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Coleman Winthorpe

title: FOIA Request – Records Relating to Rare Breed Settlement Agreement and Enforcement

Specifically, please include:
	1.	Legal Opinions or Memoranda – Any formal or informal memoranda, legal analyses, or opinions prepared by OLC regarding the Rare Breed settlement and its implications for firearms classification or ATF enforcement policy.
	2.	Interagency Communications – Communications between OLC and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF), or any DOJ components, regarding the settlement’s legal effect or potential use in enforcement matters.
	3.	Policy Guidance – Any records where OLC provided advice, clearance, or recommendations concerning whether the settlement agreement may serve as precedent or guidance in enforcement matters involving other entities.

Format

Please provide records in electronic PDF format by email or secure download link.

Segregable Portions

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Coleman Winthorpe

title: FOIA Request – Records Relating to the Rare Breed Settlement and Use in Enforcement Actions

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Records Relating to the Rare Breed Settlement and Use in Enforcement Actions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552.

I request copies of all records created, sent, or received between May 15, 2025, and the present that meet the following criteria:
	1.	Internal ATF Guidance or Directives
	•	Any memoranda, field bulletins, internal emails, or policy documents distributed to ATF personnel (including Industry Operations Investigators) that reference or discuss the May 2025 settlement agreement concerning forced reset triggers and its implications for firearms enforcement.
	2.	Use in Subsequent Matters
	•	Any records that reference the above-mentioned settlement agreement in connection with other firearms-related inspections, enforcement actions, or compliance matters involving any entity or individual other than the parties to that settlement.
	3.	Communications with Other Agencies
	•	Any communications between ATF and the Department of Justice or other federal agencies discussing the settlement agreement’s impact on agency enforcement approach to forced reset triggers.

Expedited Processing Request

I request expedited processing under 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(e)(1)(iv) because the information requested has an urgency to inform the public concerning actual or alleged Federal Government activity—specifically, ATF’s use of a private legal settlement to establish enforcement precedent affecting lawful firearms owners and manufacturers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Coleman Winthorpe

communications.communication:
Dear Coleman  Winthorpe, 

This is an automated messaged from Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) informing you that Request Number 2025-01489 has been assigned to the request you submitted. In all future correspondence regarding this request please reference case number 2025-01489. 

Please send all correspondences from within ATF FOIA Public Access Link as this is not a monitored mailbox.
Regards, 

ATF FOIA Team 
Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF)

communications.subject: Acknowledgement of FOIA Request   - 2025-01489
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Winthorpe, I hope this message finds you well. Thank you for submitting your FOIA request, reference number 2025-01489. Please find attached the formal acknowledgement letter associated with your request. If you have any questions or require further assistance, kindly use the ATF FOIAXpress PAL portal’s correspondence feature to contact our office. You can access the portal by signing in/creating an account at https://dojatf.secureocp.com .  We appreciate your cooperation and look forward to assisting you. 
Sincerely, 
ATF FOIA Team 
Note: This is not a monitored mailbox and replies to this email will not be seen or responded to. If you have any questions or concerns, please use the ATF FOIAXpress PAL portal’s correspondence feature to contact our office. You can access the portal by creating an account at https://foia-pal.atf.gov. Additionally, you can contact the FOIAPublic Liaisons at 202-648-7390 for any further assistance and to discussany aspect of your request. For technical issue with PAL, please email foia-pal-support@atf.gov. Thank you for your understanding.

files.title: Acknowledgement Letter
files.source: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, United States of America

title: New York City's Domestic Worker Mediation Program

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York City's Domestic Worker Mediation Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Information on New York City's Domestic Worker Mediation Program, including answers to the following questions:

1. How does the program define "domestic workers"?
2. The DCWP website states: "If you are a paid care worker in NYC, you have a dedicated City resource for workplace questions and complaints: the Paid Care Division within the Department of Consumer and Worker Protection (DCWP) Office of Labor Policy & Standards." Then the website goes on to define paid care workers as including both homecare and domestic workers. Does this mean that homecare workers cannot seek dispute resolution under the program?
3. Why did Mayor Adams choose to launch this program?
4. If homecare workers cannot seek mediation under the program, is there another way for them to receive support from the DCWP?
5. How do domestic workers access the program? Is there a way to file a specific request for mediation? Or does the DCWP or another department identify potential cases in need of mediation from a general intake form for workers' complaints?
6. Can you confirm the date that the program went live? Was it December 6, 2022 (the publication date of this press release from Mayor Eric Adams' office)?
7. How many complaints has the program received from the time of launch until today? Can you share both the total and an annual breakdown?
8. What percent and gross number of complaints were filed by homecare workers, such as home health aides, personal care aides, and home attendants? Can you share the breakdown of complaints by category of occupation?
9. What percent of complaints are filed by women?
10. What percent of complaints are filed by immigrants?
11. What is the average age of the complainants?
12. Were there any cases filed by employers? Or does the program take cases that are filed by workers?
13. What percent and gross number of complaints filed were about wage theft? Can you share a breakdown of complaints by complaint type?
14. What are the types of outcomes that can result from a case submitted for mediation under the program?
15. What does "resolution" mean under the program? 
16. Does "resolution" include wage recovery in wage theft cases? If so, what percent and gross amount of owed wages were returned to the workers on average?
17. Can you provide an end-to-end overview of the steps in the process, from intake to outcome?
18. Of the total number of complaints filed from launch until today, how many have been selected for mediation under the program?
19. Of the total number of complaints selected for mediation from launch until today, how many were resolved?
20. Are workers who seek resolution through the program still able to pursue litigation? Or does participation in the program prevent them from doing so?
21. How is DCWP or other offices (the Mayor's office, OATH) spreading awareness of the program, if at all?
22. What is the budget for the program?
23. Is DCWP aware of any cases of employer retaliation against workers who seek support from the program?
24. Are there any other programs by the state or city that provide similar or overlapping services?

Where possible, I'd appreciate any spreadsheets you can provide for analysis as well.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Reva Abrol

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: LA mDL Program Records (Jan 2023–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Internal evaluation or pilot assessment reports that summarize performance, adoption, risks, or “lessons learned” from the LA Wallet (Go Validate/Envoc) program between January 1, 2023 and the present.

Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with vendors or partners, including but not limited to Go Validate, Envoc, IDEMIA, AAMVA, or other providers.

Interagency or interstate coordination documents, including but not limited to MOUs or correspondence with AAMVA or other states regarding mDL interoperability, standards development, or airport integration at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: Banned books list (Texas Department of Criminal Justice)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Banned books list (Texas Department of Criminal Justice)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Banned books list (Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation)
